items.content_html: This is a lightweight, extensible, and user-friendly content editor built with pure JavaScript. It supports rich text editing, inline code, code blocks with syntax styling, tooltips, and a fully integrated emoji picker.
items.title: yeole-rohan/ray-content-editor: This is a lightweight, extensible, and user-friendly content editor built with pure JavaScript. It supports rich text editing, inline code, code blocks with syntax styling, tooltips, and a fully integrated emoji picker.

items.content_html: A lightweight event-driven microservices package for RabbitMQ in Node.js. Enables asynchronous communication, message publishing and consuming, and scalable event-driven architecture. Perfect for distributed systems and real-time applications.
items.title: ChandanJain009/nodejs-nano-service: A lightweight event-driven microservices package for RabbitMQ in Node.js. Enables asynchronous communication, message publishing and consuming, and scalable event-driven architecture. Perfect for distributed systems and real-time applications.

items.content_html: Today Notes is a lightweight, daily task management application built using Next.js, React, TailwindCSS, Prisma, and Postgresql - Supabase. It allows users to create tasks that expire in 24 hours, providing a clean and minimalist interface with support for dark and light themes.
items.title: Keyyard/today-notes: Today Notes is a lightweight, daily task management application built using Next.js, React, TailwindCSS, Prisma, and Postgresql - Supabase. It allows users to create tasks that expire in 24 hours, providing a clean and minimalist interface with support for dark and light themes.

items.content_html: A lightweight Node.js package published on NPM to simplify and automate common development tasks, designed for quick integration and ease of use.
items.title: thinakaranmanokaran/Package-Helper: A lightweight Node.js package published on NPM to simplify and automate common development tasks, designed for quick integration and ease of use.

items.content_html: ChronoUtilz is a lightweight, high-performance date utility library for JavaScript and TypeScript. Designed with minimal bundle size and developer productivity in mind, it provides essential date operations without the bloat of full-featured date libraries
items.title: Mfuon2/chrono-utilz: ChronoUtilz is a lightweight, high-performance date utility library for JavaScript and TypeScript. Designed with minimal bundle size and developer productivity in mind, it provides essential date operations without the bloat of full-featured date libraries

items.content_html: Silana Lite Official is a smart WhatsApp *** powered by AI, offering a wide range of features like automated responses, multimedia downloads, language translation, text-to-speech, and more. Lightweight and efficient, it enhances personal and group chats with customizable plugins and seamless automation for a smarter messaging experience.
items.title: noureddineouafy/silana-lite-ofc: Silana Lite Official is a smart WhatsApp *** powered by AI, offering a wide range of features like automated responses, multimedia downloads, language translation, text-to-speech, and more. Lightweight and efficient, it enhances personal and group chats with customizable plugins and seamless automation for a smarter messaging experience.

items.content_html: A lightweight Telegram bot that automatically posts IOM results, routines, and notices to a channel, built with Node.js, TypeScript, and Telegram's official API.

items.content_html: A lightweight File Manager that I am building specifically for RunPod "Network Volumes", but it can be used in any environment where volumes are mounted to the root directory. Not really intended as a consumer facing application, it's intended as a separate deployment to serverless providers that don't have dedicated file management built-in.
items.title: zacheryvaughn/network-volume-manager: A lightweight File Manager that I am building specifically for RunPod "Network Volumes", but it can be used in any environment where volumes are mounted to the root directory. Not really intended as a consumer facing application, it's intended as a separate deployment to serverless providers that don't have dedicated file management built-in.
